name: Lieutenant Markland
descriptions: Lieutenant Markland is an NCR army doctor stationed at Bitter Springs in 2281.

Markland is the medical officer and field medic at Bitter Springs. While he has extensive medical knowledge and field first aid (treating trench foot, making a tourniquet, etc.), he was not trained to treat the psychological trauma from which many of the refugees suffer.
Markland is markedly tall, much like Arcade Gannon, Aurelius of Phoenix and Lucullus.

topics.topic_text: I think I might be addicted to something.
topics.response_text: If you've seen half the things I've seen out in the Wasteland, I can't say I blame you. I might be able to help with that.

topics.topic_text: I think I'll tough it out.
topics.response_text: Suits me - I've got plenty of other patients to take care of.

topics.topic_text: Yes, cure me. Here's 50 caps.
topics.response_text: All right, there you go. And don't complain about the taste.

topics.topic_text: I'm hurt. I need help, Doc.
topics.response_text: Let me take a look.{Beat}Really? That's it? You've got a few scrapes and a hangnail. Come back when you're really hurt.

topics.topic_text: Okay, fix me. Here's 100 caps.
topics.response_text: Okay, that's about the best I can do. Try not to get hurt that bad again, it's not like I've got an endless supply of bandages.

topics.topic_text: Okay, fix me. Here's 75 caps.
topics.response_text: Okay, that's about the best I can do. Try not to get hurt that bad again, it's not like I've got an endless supply of bandages.

topics.topic_text: Okay, fix me. Here's 50 caps.
topics.response_text: Okay, that's about the best I can do. Try not to get hurt that bad again, it's not like I've got an endless supply of bandages.

topics.topic_text: On second thought, I'll be fine.
topics.response_text: Swing back by if you change your mind. I'll see what I can do for you.

topics.topic_text: Can you heal my radiation?
topics.response_text: Well, one thing we do have is a good supply of Rad-Away. Sure, I can help you with that.

topics.topic_text: No, thanks.
topics.response_text: All right, but don't blame me if you end up sterile.

topics.topic_text: Here's your 100 caps. Do it.
topics.response_text: Just stand still and try to ignore the tingling.

topics.topic_text: I need medical supplies.
topics.response_text: I'd love to help you out, but I'm pretty strapped here as it is. I really don't have anything to sell you.

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: {Impressed}It was you that rescued President Kimball, wasn't it? You're becoming quite the celebrity already.

topics.topic_text: Captain Gilles said to talk to you about medical aid for the camp.
topics.response_text: {Pleased}Hey, if you can help, I'll take whatever I can get. Doctor's Bags would be a huge help, but what I really need are medical texts.

topics.topic_text: I found those books you wanted.
topics.response_text: {Excited}Both of them? Wow, that's very resourceful. Thank you.

topics.topic_text: LtMarklandNullLink
topics.response_text: Doctor's Bags would be a huge help too.

topics.topic_text: <Give 1 Doctor's Bag> I brought you a Doctor's Bag. I hope it helps.
topics.response_text: {Grateful}Are you kidding? The supplies in this are going to save lives. Thank you.

topics.topic_text: <Give 3 Doctor's Bags> I brought you these Doctor's Bags. I hope they help.
topics.response_text: {Grateful}Thank you, this will keep us well-stocked for a good long while.

topics.topic_text: <Give 2 Doctor's Bags> I brought you these Doctor's Bags. I hope they help.
topics.response_text: {Grateful}These will be a big help, thanks.

topics.topic_text: LtMarklandTraining
topics.response_text: {Happy}Thank you, that was very helpful. I don't think I'll need those books after all.

topics.topic_text: Medical texts? Aren't you a doctor?
topics.response_text: {Frustrated, a little sad}I'm an Army field medic. I can treat bullet wounds, shrapnel, trenchfoot, no problem.

topics.topic_text: I'll keep my eyes open for books on pediatrics or psychological trauma, then.
topics.response_text: {Grateful}Thank you. Any help you can give would be a godsend.

topics.topic_text: My friend here is a doctor, maybe he could give you some training in those areas instead.
topics.response_text: {Excited}Yeah? Hey, sure, that would be fantastic!

topics.topic_text: Any idea where I might find those books?
topics.response_text: {Thoughtful}Caravan companies are probably your best bet. Smaller traders aren't likely to have anything that esoteric.

topics.topic_text: Okay, I'll see what I can do.
topics.response_text: Thanks. Anything else?

topics.topic_text: Don't sweat it, I was glad to help.
topics.response_text: {Grateful}Well, still. Thanks again.

topics.topic_text: Well, if you've got a surplus, maybe you could spare a little medicine?
topics.response_text: {A little embarassed that he forgot to offer payment}Oh! Oh, yeah, sure, I think I can spare a little. Here. And thanks again.

topics.topic_text: Some spare meds would be great - and those books weren't cheap.
topics.response_text: {A little embarassed that he forgot to offer payment}Oh! Right, of course, I can give you a few spare meds and a few caps. Here.

topics.topic_text: Thanks, that should cover my expenses.
topics.response_text: {Pleased}No problem, here you go. I'm kind of amazed you found them at all. Thanks again for everything.

topics.topic_text: Those books were pretty expensive. Maybe you can cough up a little more?
topics.response_text: {Hesitant - thinks he's being ripped off but doesn't want to say it}Really? Wow. Well, you did pay for them, so here you go. Thanks again for everything.
